description.narrative: By 2020, the Ministry of Health's technical departments are better equipped to improve quality of integrated child health services, targeting preventable diseases in particular, at health care facilities and in the community., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Hiv Prevention, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the Ministry of Health’s technical departments are better equipped to improve quality of integrated child health services, targeting preventable diseases in particular, at health care facilities and in the community.

description.narrative: With support from UNICEF, at national level, 313,220 pregnant women/338,409 (92.55%) were tested for HIV and 1,858 received full maternal-to-child transmission prevention treatment. UNICEF focus is to eliminate mother-to-child transmission (eMTCT) of residual HIV by the end of 2020. 843/912 babies born alive from HIV positive women received treatment at birth (92%). In the North region 96% (27,576 pregnant women/28,722), were tested for HIV compared to 93% (19,045 / 20,400 in 2018). 6% of pregnant women's partners were tested vs 4% in 2018. The health district of Ouahigouya has exceeded the target of 10% and is at 11%. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
